description: From Middle French impudent, from Latin impudēns (“shameless”), ultimately from in- +‎ pudere.

adjectives.description: impudent (comparative more impudent or (informal) impudenter, superlative most impudent or (informal) impudentest)

entries.meaning: Not showing due respect; bold-faced, impertinent.
examples: Synonyms: bold, brazen-faced; see also Thesaurus:cheeky
The impudent children would not stop talking in class.
